title: Evaluation and responsibility in infectious disease modelling
text:
NoteKey details




Date: 24 March 2026
Timing: 10.00 - 16.00
Location: London School of Hygiene & Tropical Medicine, Keppel St, London WC1E 7HT
Participants: 30-50 participants across academia and public health


How do we evaluate modelling work, and what does that imply about modelling responsibly? We’re aiming to bring together perspectives on model evaluation across epidemiological and public health contexts. We’ll use this to collaboratively map out professional norms and values, and experiment with what this looks like in practice by co-designing training material for responsible modellers.
The day is structured around two complementary themes:

Epidemiology, evaluation, and scientific responsibility
Public health, values, and social responsibility

The day closes with a joint priority-setting exercise, drawing across both themes to create a practical resource for considering responsibility in infectious disease modelling.

Organised by Kath Sherratt (LSHTM), Seb Funk (LSHTM), and Erica Thompson (UCL), and supported by LSHTM CMMID
